intro: Cymopterus campestris, commonly known as the field evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has slender, branched stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as meadows and disturbed soils. Cymopterus campestris is an herbaceous perennial that plays a role in supporting local pollinators and maintaining ecological diversity.
